org.gridgain.grid.cache.store
Class GridCacheStoreAdapter<K,V>

java.lang.Object
  org.gridgain.grid.cache.store.GridCacheStoreAdapter<K,V>
All Implemented Interfaces:
GridCacheStore<K,V>
Direct Known Subclasses:
GridCacheHibernateBlobStore, GridCacheJdbcBlobStore
public abstract class GridCacheStoreAdapter<K,V>
extends Object
implements GridCacheStore<K,V>

Cache storage convenience adapter. It provides default implementation for bulk operations, such as GridCacheStoreAdapter.loadAll(String, GridCacheTx, Collection, GridInClosure2), GridCacheStoreAdapter.putAll(String, GridCacheTx, Map), abd GridCacheStoreAdapter.removeAll(String, GridCacheTx, Collection) by sequentially calling corresponding GridCacheStore.load(String, GridCacheTx, Object), GridCacheStore.put(String, GridCacheTx, Object, Object), and GridCacheStore.remove(String, GridCacheTx, Object) operations. Use this adapter whenever such behaviour is acceptable. However in many cases it maybe more preferable to take advantage of database batch update functionality, and therefore default adapter implementation may not be the best option.

Note that method GridCacheStoreAdapter.loadAll(String, org.gridgain.grid.lang.GridInClosure2 , Object...) has empty implementation because it is essentially up to the user to invoke it with specific arguments.

public void loadAll(@Nullable
                    String cacheName,
                    GridInClosure2<K,V> closure,
                    Object... args)
             throws GridException
Default empty implementation. This method needs to be overridden only if GridCache.loadCache(GridPredicate2, long, Object...) method is explicitly called.

Specified by:
loadAll in interface GridCacheStore<K,V>
Throws:
GridException - If loading failed.
Parameters:
cacheName - Cache name (null for default no-name cache).
closure - Closure for loaded values.
args - Arguments passes into GridCache.loadCache(org.gridgain.grid.lang.GridPredicate2 , long, Object...) method.

loadAll

public void loadAll(@Nullable
                    String cacheName,
                    @Nullable
                    GridCacheTx tx,
                    Collection<? extends K> keys,
                    GridInClosure2<K,V> closure)
             throws GridException
Loads all values for given keys and passes every value to the provided closure.

For every loaded value method GridInClosure.apply(Object) should be called on the passed in closure. The closure will then make sure that the loaded value is stored in cache.

Specified by:
loadAll in interface GridCacheStore<K,V>
Throws:
GridException - If load failed.
Parameters:
cacheName - Cache name (null for default no-name cache).
tx - Cache transaction.
keys - Collection of keys to load.
closure - Closure to call for every loaded element.

putAll

public void putAll(@Nullable
                   String cacheName,
                   GridCacheTx tx,
                   Map<? extends K,? extends V> map)
            throws GridException
Stores given key value pairs in persistent storage. Note that cache transaction is implicitly created even for a single put, so the passed in transaction can never be null.

Specified by:
putAll in interface GridCacheStore<K,V>
Throws:
GridException - If store failed.
Parameters:
cacheName - Cache name (null for default no-name cache).
tx - Cache transaction.
map - Values to store.

removeAll

public void removeAll(@Nullable
                      String cacheName,
                      GridCacheTx tx,
                      Collection<? extends K> keys)
               throws GridException
Removes all vales identified by given keys from persistent storage. Note that cache transaction is implicitly created even for a single put, so the passed in transaction can never be null.

Specified by:
removeAll in interface GridCacheStore<K,V>
Throws:
GridException - If remove failed.
Parameters:
cacheName - Cache name (null for default no-name cache).
tx - Cache transaction.
keys - Keys to remove.

txEnd

public void txEnd(@Nullable
                  String cacheName,
                  GridCacheTx tx,
                  boolean commit)
           throws GridException
Default empty implementation for ending transactions. Note that if explicit cache transactions are not used, then transactions do not have to be explicitly ended - for all other cases this method should be overridden with custom commit/rollback logic.

Specified by:
txEnd in interface GridCacheStore<K,V>
Throws:
GridException - If commit or rollback failed. Note that commit failure in some cases may bring cache transaction into GridCacheTxState.UNKNOWN which will consequently cause all transacted entries to be invalidated.
Parameters:
cacheName - Name of the cache (null for default no-name cache).
tx - Cache transaction being ended.
commit - True if transaction should commit, false for rollback.
